Description: Black-top red ware pottery vessel of fine Nile silt clay, with rounded sides and base. The rim is milled, and the exterior walls have been coated with red slip and burnished to a fine lustre. The interior is black. The walls are 4mm thick.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Badari, el-, Grave or pit 5125
Curator's comments: Published: A. Roveri and F. Tiradritte [eds.], Kemet: Alle Sorgenti del Tempo, Ravenna 1998, p.137 [23-26]. Brunton's Black-topped Red ware BR24M
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (8; pl. xiv. 24M)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1998, 1 Mar-28 Jul . Ravenna, Italy. Museo Nazionale di Ravenna, 'Le origini Dell'Antico Egitto'
Condition: fair, reconstructed from fragments, interior coated with consolidant.
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
